entry.title: Writing workshop
entry.content:
Student Success Building, room 236
Tuesday, August 25, 2015, 11 – 11:45am

Join us for a free weekly 45-min writing workshop (Mondays + Tuesdays, 11am, 2:30pm, and 4pm) that focuses on English language and college writing skills. The topics change every week; check with Immigrant Services Program (Gregor Mieder, gmieder@msudenver.edu, or 352-7117) for the current topic or more information. The workshops will take place every Monday and Tuesday, 11am, 2:30pm, and 4pm, SSB room 236.

Contact Name: Gregor Mieder
Contact Email: gmieder@msudenver.edu
Event Types: Workshops and Training
Audience: Current Students, First Year Success
Event Sponsor: Student Academic Success Center

entry.title: Fall Welcome Back
entry.content:
9th Street Historic Park
Denver, Colorado
Wednesday, August 26, 2015, 11am – 2pm

A great way to kick off the semester! Find out about our services, meet our staff, and enjoy FREE FOOD!

Contact Name: Steve Willich
Contact Email: swillich@msudenver.edu
Event Types: Diversity/Inclusivity, Recreation
Audience: Alumni, Community Members, Current Students, Faculty Members, Parents and Families, Staff Members
Event Sponsor: Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual & Transgender Student Services at Auraria, Student Engagement & Wellness

entry.title: Delete Blood Cancer Registration Drive
entry.content:
Tivoli 261, Roger Braun Multicultural Lounge
Monday, August 31, 2015, 11am – 3pm



The Student Government Assembly (SGA) is hosting a bone marrow registration drive in honor of Alex Eldredge, an MSU Denver student who passed away March 2013 from leukemia. We are registering potential life-saving donors through Delete Blood Cancer.

The drive is scheduled for Monday, August 31 and Tuesday, September 1 in the Tivoli Multicultural Lounge (Room 261) from 11:00AM - 3:00PM.

Contact Name: Amanda Pippitt
Contact Email: apippitt@msudenver.edu
Event Types: Health & Wellness
Audience: Admitted Students, Alumni, Community Members, Current Students, Donors, Faculty Members, First Year Success, Parents and Families, Prospective Students, Staff Members, Transfer Students
Event Sponsor: Student Government Assembly
More info: www.deletebloodcancer.org…

Tuesday, September 1, 2015, 11am – 3pm



The Student Government Assembly (SGA) is hosting a bone marrow registration drive in honor of Alex Eldredge, an MSU Denver student who passed away March 2013 from leukemia. We are registering potential life-saving donors through Delete Blood Cancer.

entry.title: MSU Denver President's Welcome Back
entry.content:
In front of the Student Success Building
Wednesday, September 2, 2015, 7:30 – 9am

Faculty and staff are invited to join Dr. Jordan as he officially kicks off the fall semester with the President’s Welcome Back address.

As part of the University’s 50th anniversary year, Jordan will look back at some of the successes from our first five decades and reflect on his own 11 years as president. He also will share a preview of the year ahead, including the announcement of new initiatives, plus updates on those already underway.

Refreshments will be available at 7 a.m. and the program will begin promptly at 8 a.m.

Contact Name: Leticia Duarte
Contact Email: lduarte2@msudenver.edu
Event Types: Signature Event (President's Office Only)
Audience: Faculty Members, Staff Members
Event Sponsor: Office of Marketing and Communications, Office of the President

entry.title: Clinic #1: Chip Off the Old (Writer's) Block with Melissa
entry.content:
KC 417
Thursday, September 10, 2015, 2 – 3pm

These are free interactive one-hour sessions focused on a particular writing concept, open to all students, at all writing levels, in any class. We do ask that students reserve a seat so we can have enough handouts and plan activities for the size of the group that will attend.

Contact Name: Yvonne Reed
Contact Email: yreed@msudenver.edu
Event Types: Workshops and Training
Audience: Current Students
Event Sponsor: Writing Center
More info: tinyurl.com…

entry.title: Richard T. Castro Distinguished Professorship Reception
entry.content:
Casa Mayan, 1020 9th Street, Denver, CO
Monday, September 21, 2015, 5:30 – 7:30pm

This is an evening reception for the Richard T. Castro Distinguished Professorship. The main event will take place on September 22, but all students, staff, faculty, and community members are welcome to join us on September 21 for the opening, as well as live music and food.

entry.title: Richard T. Castro Distinguished Professorship
entry.content:
Tivoli Student Union, Denver CO
Tuesday, September 22, 2015, 9am – 9pm

This event will feature a keynote speech at 10:30 AM by Ervin Lucero, followed by a luncheon and performance. The evening portion will begin at 6:00 PM and feature an all-out music and dance performance by Erv Lucero and the Mood Express.

Audience: Admitted Students, Alumni, Community Members, Current Students, Donors, Faculty Members, First Year Success, Parents and Families, Prospective Students, Staff Members, Transfer Students

entry.title: 2015 Sankofa Lecture Series
entry.content:
St Cajetans, Lawrence Way
Denver, CO 80204
Thursday, September 24, 2015, 8am – 3pm



Hip Hop: A Soundtrack for Social Change is the theme of the 2015 Sankofa Lecture Series, the only conference in the Colorado region that situates the study of Hip Hop culture as a site of cultural literacy, identity formation, and tool for innovative and effective teaching practices. This year’s keynote address will be provided by 9th Wonder, an incomparable music Producer, DJ and college Professor.


Other activities during the event include a film screening and discussion of the critically acclaimed documentary, Hip Hop Hijabis; a featured talk by Dr. Regina N. Bradley, Assistant Professor and curator of the interactive web dialogue “Outkasted Conversations;” and informative panel sessions with members of MSU Denver's student body and faculty.


This event is FREE and open to the public.

Sponsored by MSU Denver:
Department of Africana Studies
Office of the Provost
Alumni Relations
Department of English
First-Year Writing Program
Department of History
Office of International Studies
Department of Music
Department of Political Science
Department of Sociology and Anthropology
Institute for Women’s Studies & Services
Office of Institutional Diversity
School of Education
Student Engagement & Wellness
Student Government Assembly
Student Media

Contact Name: B. Afeni McNeely Cobham
Contact Email: bcobham@msudenver.edu
Event Types: Arts & Cultural, Diversity/Inclusivity, Social Responsibility, Workshops and Training
Audience: Alumni, Community Members, Current Students, Faculty Members, Staff Members
Event Sponsor: Academic and Student Affairs, Alumni Relations, Department of Africana Studies, Department of English, Department of History, Department of Music, Department of Political Science, Department of Sociology and Anthropology, Institute for Women's Studies & Services, Office of Diversity, Office of International Studies, School of Education, Student Engagement & Wellness, Student Government Assembly, Student Media
More info: www.sankofalectureseries.com
